1.title: Da Vinci's Killer Pistol
1.plot: The guys are in Southern California where they fire a wheellock, come across what could be an uncut sheet of revolutionary currency, appraise what could be a 16th century German crossbow and evaluate a British Henry Martini Rifle.

2.title: I Love Cannons
2.plot: Califrnia becomes the land of auction opportunity. The daughter of an infantryman brings in her father's map of his journey during WWII and Sean meets Kevin, who brings in a 17th century bronze cannon.

3.title: Blunderbuss Blowout
3.plot: The guys head to Southern California for an extravaganza of military collectables. Jim shoots an 1873 Colt .45 revolver, an iconic piece of Americana from the Wild West

4.title: Sunken Treasure
4.plot: The guys head to Colorado for an extravaganza of military collectibles; shooter fires a MAC 10 submachine gun, the iconic weapon of Hollywood movies like "Pulp Fiction."

5.title: The Secret Flame
5.plot: Sean and the guys are in Colorado Springs doing what they do best: finding the best military items and weapons for their auction. Shooter examines a Kel-Tec RFB .308 rifle and carries it to the range to see if it works.

6.title: Duel to the Death
6.plot: The guys head to Southern California for an eclectic auction spanning the centuries and continents. Sean examines a pair of 18th Century dueling pistols and the heads to the shooting range.

7.title: Pirate's Deadly Pistol
7.plot: The Lords of War inspect a rare piece of WWII memorabilia that couriers used behind enemy lines. If it's authentic, it could be valued at $18,000. And one seller, disappointed to learn his Japanese katana sword was not actually Made in Japan, is in for a big surprise.

8.title: Hitler's Buzzsaw
8.plot: The guys head to Houston to fire off a German MG-42 machine gun from World War II. Known as Â"Hitler's BuzzsawÂ", the MG-42 fired 1,200 to 1,500 rounds per minute and killed thousands of Americans in Normandy.

9.title: Itchy Trigger Finger
9.plot: Sean and the Lords of War are just outside of Colorado Springs, Colo., on the hunt for the best military items and collectibles for their auction. Shooter comes across a Browning BAR rifle, first used in WWI, and heads to the shooting range to see if the weapon still fires.

10.title: Assassin's Gun
10.plot: It's a Colt single action Army gun that brings in the big bucks this week. The seller swears the gun is haunted and has a spooky story to back up his claim. But once the Lords of War fully test the weapon and jokingly exorcise the demons, the rare collectible brings in a small fortune.

11.title: Field of Screams
11.plot: Sean and the team are in Pasadena, Texas, to track down top-notch military pieces for their upcoming auction. Shooter comes across the Italian version of an M-14 and is thrilled when the seller agrees to let him test the Italian stallion out on the range

12.title: The Gun Sword
12.plot: In Cape Coral, Fla., Sean and Hammer meet a seller who grew up playing with what could be a Spanish helmet from the 16th century. If it's the real deal, this man's childhood toy could be worth thousands of dollars!

13.title: Gangster's Choice
13.plot: Sean and his team are in Cape Coral, Florida, in the search of the best military items and collectibles for their auction. Jim meets a seller with the gun that made the twenties roar - the 1928 Thompson submachine gun, a.k.a. the "Tommy Gun". This gun is famous for being used by lawmen and gangsters during the prohibition era. The seller bought this item from an estate sale, and Jim guarantees it'll fetch $13,000 at the auction - if it fires. Sean and Hammer evaluate what could be a Spanish helmet from the 16th century, which the seller and his brothers used to play ...

14.title: Special Ops
14.plot: Sean and his team are in Naples, Florida, where they awaken a sea service pistol that could have been used during the war in the Americas, evaluate what could be a Colt .45 that belonged to Buffalo Bill Cody, see if a Japanese Katana can slice through some armor, and pull the trigger on the type of gun used by the Navy SEALs.

15.title: Day of the Nighthawk
15.plot: In Fort Myers, Fla., the guys have big expectations; the city is named after a military fort, after all. It certainly doesn't disappoint when the first item they see is a 1915 Vickers, a rare machine gun.

16.title: Handheld Shotgun
16.plot: The team is in Lehigh, Florida, where they discover a rare anti-bandit gun, evaluate what could be a late 16th century treasure chest, appraise a deadly Indian thrusting dagger and test fire the famous M2 Browning machine gun.

imdb.plot outline: Lords of War brings you inside the intriguing world of historical weaponry as Sean Rich and his team of weapons experts travel across the country in search of the best in antique weapons and militaria. Journey through history as the guys assess, test, and auction the bounties of war.
imdb.title: Lords of War
plot: _Lords of War_ (qv) brings you inside the intriguing world of historical weaponry as Sean Rich and his team of weapons experts travel across the country in search of the best in antique weapons and militaria. Journey through history as the guys assess, test, and auction the bounties of war.
synopsis: Sean Rich, a former recurring expert on Pawn Stars, branches off into his own series for the National Geographic Channel. Sean and his team of experts travel all over the United States appraising antique military weapons for auction. The weapons can include guns, cannons, swords, axes, etc. Some weapons are determined to be fakes, or are just in such bad condition that they won't even accept them for the auction. Meanwhile, other weapons are tested to see if they can still fire. If they do still fire, the working theory is that they will get more money for it at the auction. For the weapons that are chosen for the auction, Sean or one his experts will give a guaranteed dollar amount that they believe they will get for it. If they hit the amount, Team Rich gets a 15% commission fee. If they don't hit that number, the fee is waived. Each episode closes with the auction where audience members are bidding in-person, on the telephone, or over the internet. Sean is the third Pawn Stars expert to get his own series, following Rick Dale with American Restoration and Danny Koker with Counting Cars. However, this is the first spin-off that is not on the History Channel.
